acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 24-hour EC50=14mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 1 based on rabbit LD50= 13mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the value LC50 (4hr) = 39ppm which was acquired by having converted Rat LC50 value (56ppm) (CERI Hazard Data (2002) and PATTY (5th, 2001)) into the value for 4 hours, it was classified as Category 1.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 15 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: CERI Hazard Data (2002), PATTY(5th, 2001)

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the existing classifications, it was set as Category 2 according to the guideline.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3, since acute toxicity was Category 3 and not rapidly degrading (BOD<=20%(CERI Hazard Data (2002)), though supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=-0.28(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: UNRTDG  No.1185, Class: 6.1, Subsidiary risks Class: 3, PGI

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1B because the result of the in vivo dominant lethal test is positive (CERI Hazard Data (2002)).

organic_peroxides.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with peroxide present in the molecule.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It is reported in ACGIH (2001) about "the effect to rat fetus and the decrease of pregnancy rate of dam animals under the condition that there were the reduced weight of the dam animals, and the effect to generative organ of father." And they are considered as in the Category 2.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization is uncategorizable because of no data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: It is classified into UN class (UN No.1185; class 6.1, secondary class 3 PGI) under the condition of stabilization. The general traffic products to which stabilizer was added are outside Category.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on description with severe irritation (CERI Hazard Data, 2002), and with the injury of a cornea (CERI Hazard Data, 2002), and skin corrosivenesses / irritation was categoried into 1, it was set to Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It is known that this product produces a burn on human skin. Since the case where it caused refractory dermatitis has been reported (CERI Hazard Data, 2002), it was classified as Category 1. But detailed classifications cannot be performed because of insufficient data.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classified as Category 1 because two cases of skin sensitization is reported in humans (ACGIH (2001)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, liver, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat inhalation exposure study,    based on the reports of effects in respiratory system, the kidney, and liver at the value less than the guidance value of Category 1(CERI Hazard Data (2002)) (ACGIH (2001))(PATTY (5th, 2001)), they were classified into Category 1 in each target organs.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (central nervous system, kidney, liver, lung),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (central nervous system, kidney, liver, lung)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1. Based on the reports of the serious effects on the central nervous system, kidneys and liver among the people who handle it (ACGIH, 2001), and of the development of pulmonary edema after exposure by inhalation (ACGIH (2001), ICSCJ (2002)). The substance was classified as Category 3 for its airway irritant property, based on the report: "the substance has an irritant property to the human respiratory system" (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).
